Container.Name: Firefly-III-Importer
Container.Overview:
DESCRIPTION The Data Importer helps you to import transactions into Firefly III. It is separated from Firefly III for security and maintenance reasons.
The Data Importer does not connect to your bank directly. Instead, it uses Nordigen and SaltEdge to connect to over 6000 banks worldwide. These services are free for Firefly III users, but require registration. Keep in mind these services have their own privacy and data usage policies.
The Data Importer can import CSV files you've downloaded from your bank. You can run the Data Importer once, for a bulk import. You can also run it regularly to keep up with new transactions.
NOTES • Available tags for this docker image: 'latest' (stable) and 'develop'. • To generate your token, go to: Firefly III > Options > Profile > OAuth > 'Personal Access Tokens'. • There are other variables that you can use, if needed. Check the '.env.example' file of the GitHub repo to know more. • When setting both 'FIREFLY_III_URL' and/or 'VANITY_URL', make sure to add 'http://' or 'https://', even if in local, and remove any trailing slash at the end of it. • Use the 'Reauthenticate' button if you have re-generated your token, or if you may suffer any other issue while trying to connect to Firefly. • Memcached and Redis are not required, but you can connect them to Firefly III Data Importer if you experience any performance issues. Check the '.env.example' file of the GitHub repo to know more.
VERSION 1.0 (2022-05-28)

Config.Name: FIREFLY_III_URL
Config.Description: This is the address of the Firefly III instance, it can be HTTP or HTTPS.

Config.Name: VANITY_URL
Config.Description: This is a fallback address for the Firefly III instance, it can be HTTP or HTTPS.

Config.Name: FIREFLY_III_ACCESS_TOKEN
Config.Description: This is your Personal Access Token, generated from your Firefly III account.

Config.Name: Storage (uploads)
Config.Description: This is the location for the uploaded files.

Config.Name: APP_NAME
Config.Description: This is the app name (browser's tab).
